headline: Ask HN: Solar PV vs. Thermoelectric
description:
One of the main complaints against Solar Photovoltaic systems is the limited availability of sunlight due to time of day constraints or latitudinal constraints. Solid-state thermoelectric devices operating on the Seebeck effect only require a temperature gradient to produce a voltage.

If we combined a thermoelectric device with surfaces engineered for heat absorption (eg: a black coated surface) and passive radiative cooling (eg: ultra-white coated surface) would we be able to maintain a temperature gradient and break the time-of-day and latitudinal constraints of solar?

1. What are some of the challenges with this approach? 2. What are some ways this could be improved to make it practical?

References:

Xiangyu Li et al., Full Daytime Sub-ambient Radiative Cooling in Commercial-like Paints with High Figure of Merit. Cell Reports Physical Science, Vol 1-10, 2020. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.xcrp.2020.100221

headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: 太阳能光伏发电与热电联产
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: 太陽能光伏發電與熱電聯產
description_zh-Hans:
对太阳能光伏系统的主要抱怨之一是，由于一天中的时间限制或纬度限制，太阳光的可用性有限。

如果我们将热电装置与为吸热而设计的表面（如：黑色涂层表面）和被动辐射冷却（如：超白涂层表面）相结合，我们是否能够保持温度梯度，打破太阳能的时间和纬度限制？这种方法有哪些挑战？ 2. 2.有哪些方法可以改进以使其实用？

参考文献：

李翔宇等，《具有高优点的商业类涂料的全日亚环境辐射冷却》。Cell Reports Physical Science, Vol 1-10, 2020. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.xcrp.2020.100221
